nodes.bodyText: Usually, we prefer enums instead of booleans, it makes it easier to extend it the future.
Can you add more description here, please? What is the purpose of the subnetids?
Added more detail. Please check out the updated descriptions and let me know if they're sufficient.
this fields can not be not null because in case of a production roll back we need to use the modified scheme with the previous CB version
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,11 @@
+-- // CB-10242 API changes for semi-private networks
+-- Migration SQL that makes the change goes here.
+
+ALTER TABLE environment_network ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS usepublicendpointaccessgateway BOOLEAN NOT NULL DEFAULT false;

nodes.bodyText:
Default value shouldn't be added like this. It will block the whole table.
See https://dba.stackexchange.com/questions/60965/does-postgresql-optimize-adding-columns-with-non-null-defaults/216153#216153
Example: https://github.com/hortonworks/cloudbreak/blob/master/core/src/main/resources/schema/app/20201130155647_CB-9580_new_field_on_cluster:_embedded_db_is_configured_on_attached_disk_or_not.sql
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,11 @@
+-- // CB-10242 API changes for semi-private networks
+-- Migration SQL that makes the change goes here.
+
+ALTER TABLE environment_network ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS usepublicendpointaccessgateway BOOLEAN NOT NULL DEFAULT false;

nodes.bodyText: I've created an enum PublicEndpointAccessGateway with values ENABLED and DISABLED, and used it in all the objects that have usePublicEndpointAccessGateway.
we can not set nullable = false here
